intro: Caruelina fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered caruelina, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in countries like Brazil and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its clustered growth habit and slender, hollow stems. Its small, white or greenish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Caruelina fasciculata is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
